content.rendered:
SSOM VENDOR CODE OF CONDUCT 2021

  • To be respectful and courteous to all Main Street Merchants, other event vendors, SSOM volunteers and staff, and the public in attendance.Â 

  • To be inclusive this is an all ages event. Please be sure your goods are appropriate for minors and use your best judgement when selling goods that contain adult material such as adult activity, harsh language, intense graphic violence, drug abuse and nudity.

  • To give Second Sunday on Main events the highest quality food, merchandise and/or service possible.

  • To cooperate with Second Sunday on Main staff and volunteers, and have fun!

  • To help promote Second Sunday on Main by telling people about the festival.

  • To clean up the site and leave your Main Street vending space in as-good or better condition than when you arrived.

  • To be responsible for your own product, materials, sales taxes, licenses, permits, insurance and fees as necessary and/or required by law.

  • To understand that application fees are non-refundable once accepted to the event.

  • To comply with everything in the vendor application and all conditions set forth in this application including the release/consent of your picture.

  • To be respectful and courteous to all Main Street merchants, vendors, performers, and patrons please do not use any generators or loud devices that will disrupt others.
